State election records confirm only one: when Robin Vos took over as Speaker.
Wisconsin is among the most gerrymandere: with heavily skewed maps drawn by Wisconsin Republicans in 2011 to secure Republican control of the Assembly.
In the 2018 election: Republicans didn't even bother sending out a candidate in 27 of the 36 Assembly districts won by Democrats.
Robyn Vining: a Democrat, claimed that her win in 2018 was unique during the tenure of Assembly Speaker Robin Vos, stating that it was the first time Speaker Vos has lost a seat.
